page.title: 04Changing Times In Woolton
page.content: Since the end of the war Corporation estates have been built in Woolton and blocks of high-storey{flats.}The very old village houses still remain. The Woolton Village Club holds its Centenary this year. The Post Office remained a sub-office until 1963 when the modern crown office was opened. Many people remember the{trams} swaying along Menlove Avenue. They brought many children to Woolton Woods in the summer holidays. Buses replaced the trams in 1949. The advent of the modern Washeteria is another instance of change. The modern disposal motor vans used by the dustmen are a great change from the horsedrawn carts. Woolton has also become a{smokeless {zone.} Sainsbury's new{shopping precinct} has brought much more traffic to the village. J.E.PARRY.
